title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

South Korea’s Financial Supervisory Service (FSS) chief Lee Bok-Hyun revealed plans to meet global regulators, including the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) chairman, Gary Gensler to discuss crypto. El Salvador president Nayib Bukele has declared his victory in the El Salvador general elections, though the official results have yet to be released. Meanwhile, the Bitcoin Ordinals market cooled off last month after a record-setting December.

A top South Korean regulator is planning to visit the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) chairman, Gary Gensler, for discussing spot Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded fund (ETF).

South Korea’s Financial Supervisory Service (FSS) chief, Lee Bok-Hyun presented a business plan for 2024 at the Financial Supervisory Service in Seoul on Feb. 5, which includes visits to major advanced financial markets, such as New York, in the second quarter of the year to discuss various aspects of South Korean financial markets.

Read more

title: Hong Kong sets deadline for crypto exchange licensing applications or face shutdown
description:
Hong Kong’s Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) told unregistered Virtual Asset Trading Platforms (VATPs) within its region to submit their licensing applications by Feb. 29 or close their businesses by May 31, according to a Feb. 5 notice. The financial regulatory authority reaffirmed this deadline for cryptocurrency trading firms while advising investors to engage with […]

The post Hong Kong sets deadline for crypto exchange licensing applications or face shutdown appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: Global Economic Outlook Brightens as Inflation Recedes, with the U.S. Leading the Charge
description: As 2024 unfolds, the global economy is embracing a wave of optimism, marked by diminishing inflation and resilient growth that has surpassed expectations. Among developed nations, the United States is particularly noteworthy for its economic vigor. According to a report by Jeanna Smialek, Ana Swanson, Alan Rappeport and Jim Tankersley for The New York Times […]

title: Canadian regulator accuses Einstein crypto exchange of fraud
description: In a significant development within the cryptocurrency sector, the British Columbia Securities Commission (BCSC) has accused the now-defunct Einstein Exchange of operating as a Ponzi scheme following its insolvency in 2018. This announcement brings to light the precarious nature of the operations behind the Canadian cryptocurrency trading platform, which had promised to offer a reliable […]

title: Thales Secures £1.8 Billion Contract to Boost Royal Navy’s Operational Resilience
description: Discover the latest contract secured by Thales to enhance Royal Navy's operational resilience and create jobs, while utilizing cutting-edge technology for predictive maintenance.

title: Bitcoin miner Argo Blockchain shares plunge 8% following production decrease
description: Argo Blockchain’s shares plunged by 7.5% on Monday after the London-based mining company disclosed a 20% decrease in mined Bitcoin in January. As per the company’s January financial update, Argo Blockchain mined 124 BTC, representing a 20% decline in daily…

title: Crucial Crypto and Bitcoin Milestones Await, With Powell’s Rate Cut Caution in the Spotlight
description: Decisive events in the cryptocurrency market soon, possibly affecting Bitcoin and other digital currencies, watched closely. Jerome Powell, Fed chairman, shows caution on rate adjustments, influencing the dynamism of the crypto market. title: New Billion-Dollar Market for Spot Bitcoin ETFs: South Korean Regulator to Discuss Bitcoin ETF with US SEC’s Gary Gensler
description: South Korea’s FSS Governor Lee Bok-hyun plans to meet with SEC Chairman Gary Gensler. Topics of discussion include the Bitcoin spot ETF and possible changes to cryptoasset regulation. Lee Bok-hyun, governor of South Korea’s Financial Supervisory Service (FSS), is scheduled to meet with Gary Gensler, chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). At [...]

title: Shiba Inu Gears Up: 600% Surge in Token Burn Rate Sparks Frenzy
description: Shiba Inu’s burn rate skyrocketed by 660.52% in just 24 hours, thanks to active community involvement and the adoption of Shibarium. Two specific wallet addresses burned millions of SHIB tokens, contributing to the surge in the burn rate. The Shiba Inu cryptocurrency has witnessed a substantial spike in its burn rate, recording a staggering 660.52% [...]

title: Helium Mobile Hits 45,000 Subscribers with NFT-Based Plan
description:
This milestone is not just a number; it’s a testament to the growing trust and interest in blockchain-based services among consumers. Helium Mobile employs a unique model where subscriber NFTs are minted for every new subscriber who signs up for their phone plan. NFTs Transform Helium Mobile’s Subscriber Growth The use of NFTs to track […]

title: Negative News Leads to Loss of XRP Holders, While Scapesmania Enjoys Growing Popularity
description:
Ripple (XRP) has stood out in the cryptocurrency landscape for its efficient and low-cost solutions for cross-border payments. Leveraging decentralized blockchain technology, it aims to execute transactions across various currencies swiftly, setting itself apart by catering primarily to banks and financial institutions. Despite its prominence, Ripple (XRP) has encountered hurdles recently, notably due to a […]
